result.execSummary:
The defendant Chance S. Sayre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on January 23, 2015 before the Honorable Sarah O' Brien

Case called at 10:00 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Chance S. Sayre in court, in-custody. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pat Sayre present.
ADA Hall: State objects to weapon being returned, presents basis
Court reviews 968.20(1m)(b) with Mr. Pat Sayre

Patrick Sam Sayre--sworn & testifies
--exam by the Court
--exam by ADA Hall

Chance Sayre--sworn & testifies
--direct testimony of Mr. Sayre
--exam by ADA Hall
Evidence Closed; Argument by ADA Hall

Court determines that the owner of the handgun is Mr. Pat Sayre and that he is entitled to have the firearm returned to him. Pursuant to hearing held today's date, the Court orders that the black handgun SN003879 STEYR M-40 (serial#003879) with 2 full magazines, returned to the rightful owner, Pay Sayre.
Court directs Clerk to prepare an order and informs Mr. Pat Sayre that he can pick up a copy of the order tomorrow morning at the Clerk's Office.
Recess: 10:22 am 

NEXT: (1) Clerk to prepare order
Request to schedule hearing is granted
from non-party re: request to reschedule 2/27/15 hearing
Letter from non-party ref firearm in this case
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:20 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Chance S. Sayre in court, in-custody with Attorney Yelena Zarwell on behalf Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Sayre to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:

On Count #3, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 90 days jail, consecutive to Count #1 and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:

Conditions of Probation as to Counts #1 & #3:
--serve 130 days in Jefferson County Jail (On Ct#1), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Random urinalyses
--Certified Batterers Treatment and Intervention Programming & follow-through if necessary
--Mental Health Assessment and follow-through as recommended
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession of any ammunition or firearms
--To pay costs of $268 (Ct#1)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (Ct#1)
--To pay costs of $243 (Ct#3)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (Ct#3)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (Ct#3)

If revoked, The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
If revoked, The Court orders that conditions of probation will become conditions of extended supervision
The Court gives 55 days credit for time already served.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court notes that the stipulation of parties
Recess: 2:38 pm
Status conference on January 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Chance S. Sayre in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Sayre waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Mr. Sayre requests the Court lift the No Contact order
ADA Hall requests notice of bond modification, written notice
Recess: 8:54 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 1/7/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 1/23/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Emergency Application for Continuance is approved
Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:17 pm
Defendant Chance S. Sayre in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; felony charge and maximum penalties recited; reading of misdemeanor charges and maximum penalties waived.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1 - #3.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession of any dangerous weapons
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No contact with Tina Olsen or their children 
-No presence at 219 Bishop Circle Waterloo, except may return on one occassion with law enforcement to obtain his personal belongings

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. 
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:32 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 12/5/14 at 8:30 am
